content:
Which of the following is TRUE:
W) chimpanzees are an ancestor of Homo sapiens
X) bipedal motion dominated hominoid ancestors by about 30 million years ago
Y) humans and modern apes have a common ancestor
Z) Neanderthals were ancestors to modern humans
subject: BIOLOGY
answer: Y) HUMANS AND MODERN APES HAVE A COMMON ANCESTOR

content:
Order the following 5 taxonomic group with the MOST members to
the one with the FEWEST members: genus; order; phylum; class; family
subject: BIOLOGY

content:
Which of the following is an element that is very important to
human life, is contained in vitamin B-12, belongs to a group of transition metals, and has magnetic
properties like iron:
W) selenium
X) cobalt
Y) zinc
Z) manganese
subject: CHEMISTRY

content: What is the pH of a 1 molar NaOH solution at 25ºC?
subject: CHEMISTRY

content:
Which of the following is the most common instrument used for
measuring gas pressure:
W) manometer
X) anemometer
Y) tensitometer
Z) flow-meter
subject: PHYSICS

content:
Which of the following is TRUE of a sound wave traveling in dry
air at STP at a constant velocity:
W) if frequency increases, wavelength increases
X) if frequency increases, wavelength decreases
Y) if frequency decreases, wavelength decreases
Z) if frequency increases, wavelength stays the same
subject: PHYSICS
answer: X) IF FREQUENCY INCREASES, WAVELENGTH DECREASES

content:
If the shortest leg of a 30-60-90 right triangle is 6 inches, what is the
measure, in inches, of the other 2 sides?
subject: MATH

content:
Consider triangle ABC, where the measure of angle A = 20º, B =117º, and
C = 43º. Arrange the 3 sides in order of increasing length:
subject: MATH
answer: BC; AB; AC(Solution: the longer side is opposite the greater angle)High School Round 4 Page 2

content:
Ocean tides of diminished range are called:
W) spring tides
X) neap tides
Y) diurnal tides
Z) semi-diurnal tides
subject: EARTH SCIENCE

content:
Which of the following was a time when glaciation was
minimal on Earth:
W) Cretaceous Period
X) Quaternary Period
Y) Holocene Epoch
Z) Pleistocene Epoch
subject: EARTH SCIENCE

content: 1 bar equals how many Pascals?
subject: GENERAL SCIENCE

content:
Meteorologists commonly use the hectopascal for air
pressure. 1,000 hectopascals equals how many millibars?
subject: GENERAL SCIENCE

content:
What planet of our solar system has the most nitrogen-rich
atmosphere?
subject: ASTRONOMY

the following:
W) spiral
X) elliptical
Y) irregular
Z) dwarf

content:
What is the common name for the product of human lachrymal (read
as: LACK-reh-mal) glands?
subject: BIOLOGY

content:

dispersed by wind: dandelion; milkweed; maize; lupine
subject: BIOLOGY

content:

W) ammonia
X) dilute sulfuric acid
Y) 1 molar sodium chloride
Z) dilute perchloric acid
subject: CHEMISTRY

content:
A molecular solid will most typically have which of the
following melting points:
W) very high
X) high to very high
Y) low
Z) variable
subject: CHEMISTRY

content:
What particle of an atom is most directly responsible for the emission
of light when an atom is excited by electromagnetic radiation?
subject: PHYSICS

content:
What is the wavelength, in meters, of a wave moving at 500 meters
per second if its frequency is 20 Hertz?
subject: PHYSICS
answer: 25(Solution: λ = wave speed/f; 500/20 = 25 m)High School Round 4 Page 5

content:
Simplify the following expression: x2x5
9
subject: MATH

content:
What is the slope of a line perpendicular to the line given by the graph of
the equation, –5x = –6y + 4
6
subject: MATH

content:
When rain freezes into pellets while falling to the ground
during a winter storm, the most accurate forecast would have predicted:
W) hail
X) snow
Y) freezing rain
Z) sleet
subject: EARTH SCIENCE

content:
Identify each of the following 3 rocks, respectively, as
igneous, metamorphic, or sedimentary: marble; pumice; conglomerate
subject: EARTH SCIENCE
answer: MARBLE = METAMORPHIC; PUMICE = IGNEOUS; CONGLOMERATE =SEDIMENTARYHigh School Round 4 Page 6

content:
Bioluminescence is a phenomenon most common in
which of the following environments:
W) marine
X) fresh water
Y) land
Z) atmosphere
subject: GENERAL SCIENCE

content:
Which of the following is a mixing incompatibility of
common household products that can produce toxic products:
W) vinegar and baking soda
X) vinegar and bleach
Y) vinegar and borax
Z) castile soap and salt
subject: GENERAL SCIENCE
answer: X) VINEGAR AND BLEACH(Solution: small amounts of vinegar can be added to bleach to acidify the bleach, but it’s generallynot a good idea to mix these two solutions)

content:
Which of the following is the primary characteristic of the
Jovian planets:
W) high axial spin rates
X) low mean density
Y) retrograde orbits
Z) prominent layer of liquid-metallic hydrogen
subject: ASTRONOMY

content:
Which one of the Gas Giant planets emits the LEAST amount of
energy?
subject: ASTRONOMY

W) rectal plexus
X) cloaca (read as: KLO-aye-ka)
Y) rostrum
Z) spiculum

zygomatic (read as: ZYE-go-MAT-ick) arch found:
W) shoulder
X) pelvis
Y) head
Z) knee
subject: BIOLOGY

content: What is the bond order between the 2 carbon atoms in acetylene?
subject: CHEMISTRY

subject: CHEMISTRY

have?

oxygen-15 nucleus, respectively?

content:
Which of the following is NOT a Pythagorean triple:
W) 15, 20, 25
X) 10, 24, 26
Y) 16, 24, 30
Z) 33, 44, 55
subject: MATH

content:
Evaluate the following expression when a = , b = 4, c = –1, and
3
d = –5: 2[3a – (b + c) – 4d]
subject: MATH

content:
Cirrus clouds are typically found at elevations of:
W) 20,000 feet and above
X) 10,000 to 20,000 feet
Y) 5,000 to 10,000 feet
Z) 2,000 to 5,000 feet
subject: EARTH SCIENCE

content:
Andesitic magmas typically erupt above:
W) hot spots
X) divergent plate boundaries
Y) subduction zones
Z) fissure eruptions
subject: EARTH SCIENCE

content:
Which of the following is the main reason why
Africanized honey bees are much more dangerous to humans and animals than European honey
bees:
W) they defend their nests more intensely
X) their venom is 10-times more potent
Y) they can sting multiple times
Z) they are larger and carry more venom
subject: GENERAL SCIENCE
answer: W) THEY DEFEND THEIR NESTS MORE INTENSELY

content: In most cars, what acts as the circuit ground?
subject: GENERAL SCIENCE
answer: THE BODY (ACCEPT: FRAME or CHASSIS)High School Round 4 Page 10

X) July
Y) August
Z) December
